intro: Anisonema dubium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, often with three stamens and a single pistil. Anisonema dubium is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
